messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
    # TRANSLATION NOTE: these functions are inside a class `ParserBase.`
    # Internal -- scan past <!NOTATION declarations
    def _parse_doctype_notation(self, i, declstartpos):
        name, j = self._scan_name(i, declstartpos)   # --- py stmt 1
        if j < 0:   # --- py stmt 2
            return j   # --- py stmt 3
        rawdata = self.rawdata   # --- py stmt 4
        while 1:   # --- py stmt 5
            c = rawdata[j:j+1]   # --- py stmt 6
            if not c:   # --- py stmt 7
                # end of buffer; incomplete
                return -1   # --- py stmt 8
            if c == '>':   # --- py stmt 9
                return j + 1   # --- py stmt 10
            if c in "'\"":   # --- py stmt 11
                m = _declstringlit_match(rawdata, j)   # --- py stmt 12
                if not m:   # --- py stmt 13
                    return -1   # --- py stmt 14
                j = m.end()   # --- py stmt 15
            else:   # --- py stmt 16
                name, j = self._scan_name(j, declstartpos)   # --- py stmt 17
                if j < 0:   # --- py stmt 18
                    return j   # --- py stmt 19
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
    // TRANSLATION NOTE: these functions are inside a class `ParserBase.`
    // Internal -- scan past <!NOTATION declarations
    _parse_doctype_notation(i, declstartpos) {
        let name, j;   // --- js stmt 1
        [name, j] = this._scan_name(i, declstartpos);   // --- js stmt 1
        if (j < 0) {   // --- js stmt 2
            return j;   // --- js stmt 3
        }
        let rawdata = this.rawdata;   // --- js stmt 4
        while (true) {   // --- js stmt 5
            let c = rawdata.slice(j, j + 1);   // --- js stmt 6
            if (!c) {   // --- js stmt 7
                // end of buffer; incomplete
                return -1;   // --- js stmt 8
            }
            if (c === '>') {   // --- js stmt 9
                return j + 1;   // --- js stmt 10
            }
            if (c === "'" || c === '"') {   // --- js stmt 11
                let m = _declstringlit_match(rawdata, j);   // --- js stmt 12
                if (!m) {   // --- js stmt 13
                    return -1;   // --- js stmt 14
                }
                j = m.end();   // --- js stmt 15
            } else {   // --- js stmt 16
                [name, j] = this._scan_name(j, declstartpos);   // --- js stmt 17
                if (j < 0) {   // --- js stmt 18
                    return j;   // --- js stmt 19
                }
            }
        }
    }
```
